intro: Tetrapterys crebriflora f. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular-leaved tetrapterys, is a variant of the species native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its densely glandular leaves, which are covered in small, sticky secretory structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate in shape, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with yellow petals, and the plant produces small, spherical fruits.
